author: Colin Bowles
title: Hokies Fall in South Beach
text:
Hokies Fall in South Beach - WVVA TV Bluefield Beckley WV News, Weather and Sports Member Center: Hokies Fall in South Beach Posted: MIAMI GARDENS, FL (WVVA) - 
Virginia Tech fell to the Miami Hurricanes in South Beach, 30-20 Saturday night. 
Brenden Motley finished the afternoon by going 14 for 23 for 136 yards with a touchdown and two interceptions. Quarterback Michael Brewer was active after breaking his collarbone back in August but did not start. He did get in however in the fourth quarter and threw four times completing three of those passes with one going for a touchdown and one for an interception. 
Tech made it a back-n-forth game the whole way but after Tech scored a touchdown to cut Miami's lead to 23-20 midway through the fourth quarter, Brad Kaaya led a nine-play drive and capped it by throwing a 2-yard touchdown pass to Rashawn Scott with 2:44 to go. 
The Hokies will be back home Saturday as they will play host to Duke. Virginia Tech fell to the Miami Hurricanes in South Beach, 30-20 Saturday night.
